website_summaries.verdict: While some have had issues with this option solidifying in the bottle before use, if you clear that hurdle, you'll wind up with an effective sealant that is easy to use.
pros: Seals gashes as well as holes
The nozzle works well for nearly mess-free filling
Doesn't ball up in tires as much as other products
cons: Dries out more quickly than other brands
According to some buyers, sometimes it will even dry up before you can get it out of the bottle

customer_reviews.title: Great sealant, bad bottle
customer_reviews.text: My go to sealant. I’ve used on several bikes without any issues so why change. The problem I have is with the bottle. It’s an 8oz bottle and instructions say to use 2-4 oz per tire depending on tire size, and it comes with the tube to poor from bottle to tire stem. BUT THERE ARE NO MEASUREMENTS ON THE BOTTLE. So you have to guess how much you’ve used, or pour out a measurement but then you can’t use the bottle and tube. Please fix the design flaw on the bottle!
customer_reviews.author: VolFan

customer_reviews.title: My go to for sealant
customer_reviews.text: I've never been a fan of just dumping sealant into a tyre and THEN seating and inflating (personal preference maybe, but also it's way cleaner if the rubber doesn't seat on the first go). Orange's product come with an injector and one bottle will do two 650b or 29" rims. Yes, you'll have to get a core remover if you don't already have one, but if you're doing your own bike maintenance and looking at this product, you should get one anyway.
customer_reviews.author: D. E.

customer_reviews.title: Fixed pinhole leak in Onewheel tire.
customer_reviews.text: My Onewheel Vega tire had a slow leak. Super annoying. I would have to inflate before each ride and even slightly over-inflate before long rides. The tire was relatively new and I didn't want to replace it. I had troubling finding the leak. Was thinking of plugging it when I came across this and thought I'd try it as it seemed easier. This sealant did the trick on the first time I used it. It's been two weeks and the tire is holding pressure. Relatively quick and easy fix, though getting the tube over the tire stem was a pain. You can see and hear it working as it bubbles and oozes out initially. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: metermill

customer_reviews.title: clearly a ripoff
customer_reviews.text: Product not as advertised. No injection system included, bottle only. Had been opened and obviously diluted down. I contacted the Better Business Bureau. Shame on the seller, shame on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: Just like water....
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why people say this stuff is good and better than stans. It has the consistency of water... I've ridden out west and in the mountains east and regardless of the terrain and regardless of how much of this I dump into my bleeding tires this never seals. I ran over nails with a stans filled tire and it plugged in under 15 seconds, this stuff I've hit pins people have tossed on trails and have bled out leaving orange crap everywhere. junk
customer_reviews.author: Salad

customer_reviews.title: Almost easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Put thiS in my tires yesterday. Only glitch was that the injection system didn’t fit the valve stem. Too big to fit in and too small to fit over. I did manage to screw the injection lid onto the valve stem then pour the sealant in. Semi minor glitch
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, not too happy!
customer_reviews.text: Usually I’m pretty happy when I receive a delivery from Amazon, but this time I’m not too pleased! I’m grateful that someone had the foresight to wrap this bottle of Orange Tubeless Sealant in a plastic bag, but it was still a really bad mess with half of the sealant leaking out of its container!
customer_reviews.author: Donny Mazinga

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: I went back to tubes when I couldn't get the other seal product to work. Someone told me about Orange Seal so I figured I'd go back to tubeless and try it. Ever since I put it in I have not had to refill my tires. With the other brand I had to add air every time I went out.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Urrea

customer_reviews.title: Works great and way cheaper than the rest
customer_reviews.text: Put this stuff in a tubeless 27.5x2.8 that was losing air all the time. It’s been weeks now with now with no air pressure drop. Stuff works amazingly well. I put it in all my bikes now.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Easiest application - No mess
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first to use this as my goal was to add sealant with no mess (doing this in my carpeted living room) but the included application hose fits perfectly around the Presta Valve and filled the tire with zero overspill.
customer_reviews.author: Flip

customer_reviews.title: My new "goto seal" for all my tubeless 29er FS Bikes...
customer_reviews.text: So far I like the OrangeSeal, Been using Stans for many years and this is a bit lighter and also seems to seal up some of the slightly large punctures that may have otherwise thwarted Stans. If it lasts just as long as the stars does before evaporation, this will be my new goto seal for my tubeless 29er FS Bikes...
customer_reviews.author: Mark Maining

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This works great, tested it on 3 tubes with lots of pin holes and they are all useable again. Not sure why people have problems, probably user error. Read the directions and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Oldcarsbreakdown

customer_reviews.title: Good Overall
customer_reviews.text: Good Product overall the only issue is the injector is difficult to use end up buying the separate injector for almost he same price like sealant.
customer_reviews.author: manish

customer_reviews.title: It's the best
customer_reviews.text: I've tried most of the stuff out there, Stan's, Slime, Tufo, Vittoria etc. and none of them compare to this stuff. Pros: Does not clump up Stops leaks much better than anything else I have used Leaks do not seem to weep later Easy to use packaging Cons: I guess it's a little more expensive? Harder to find in the stores
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Converted my Cannondale Lefty 29er's tires from tubed to tubless, this worked great! Back tire leaked a bit at first, added some more and no leaks
customer_reviews.author: D. Hickle

customer_reviews.title: Stop flats on e-bikes!
customer_reviews.text: I was getting too many flats on my fat tire e-bike. This has stopped most flats. I have also added a liner. Wouldn't go without it!
customer_reviews.author: Booklover Seattle

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: 2014 Trem Remedy 9: Worked very well. I bought this for my tubeless tire but I ended up using it for my tubed tire. Does anyone know what the metal shavings are for? Though I wish it came with an extra rubber hose and adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great sealant for tubeless tires
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several sealants and so far the Orange Seal is working great. The bottle comes ready to work with a tube that locks onto the bottle top with the other end ready to fit the Presta valve (with the core removed).
customer_reviews.author: S. E. T.

customer_reviews.title: Don't ride without it
customer_reviews.text: In Arizona everything seems to bite sting or have thorns. As such it is important to be able to self seal bicycle tires if you're going to be able to ride longer distances. This product fulfills the need well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: As described/ shown
customer_reviews.text: Came with the tube as shown. Seems like some didn’t get theirs but I did. Anyway, so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Your Mom's House

customer_reviews.title: Reusable Easy Injector
customer_reviews.text: The bottle makes it incredibly easy to inject the sealant. You can also refill the bottle and reuse it as an injector. My tires seem to be holding air much better. This product is a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: This works.
customer_reviews.text: I had three Continental Gator Skin tires, that never puncture, develop slow leaks while riding some awful roads, applied this to them following directions, and I'm ahead three tires.
customer_reviews.author: felix diaz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tire sealant
customer_reviews.text: This tire sealant is very easy to use, especially if you have a removable valve core, and it seems to do a great job sealing up any holes or leaks. I had an issue with my tubeless tires always leaking air, albeit slowly, but I did always have to add air before going for a ride. Since adding this sealant, I haven't had to adjust the tire pressure at all!
customer_reviews.author: William S Akin

customer_reviews.title: I want ORIGINAL Orange Seal as listed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the ORIGINAL formula - they sent ENDURANCE. I returned it and they sent ENDURANCE again. Stoopid!
customer_reviews.author: john pc

customer_reviews.title: Better than Stans
customer_reviews.text: Better than Stans, stays liquid and doesn't "booger" up as badly as Stans.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Randall

customer_reviews.title: Seals quite well, no Sealant-Buggers!
customer_reviews.text: Orange Seal does its job quite well. Rode through a patch of sandspurs and after the ride I could see tiny light beige dots in the tires where Orange Seal sealed the holes. Doesn't create sealant buggers like some other brands.
customer_reviews.author: RayT

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Way better than Stan's. Easy to use and great sealing power!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good sealant.
customer_reviews.text: First year on road tubeless and this has not let me down. Once I did flat and it was because my sealant was low. I recommend checking every other month at the longest.
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Szot

customer_reviews.title: Best brand I've tried yet
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply and hasn't let me down yet! Will be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: would love to try and use it one day
customer_reviews.text: haven't needed to use it... also i've been traveling so much that I'm not even in an area where I have access to my bike.. would love to try and use it one day. Supposed to be the best of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Works great and for the price you can't beat it. This is now my go-to from here on out. After it sealed up my old best tire with sidewall damage and many hard miles I am a believer.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Victor

customer_reviews.title: Best tubeless good ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best stuff ever for tubeless bike tires! Going on two years with my 29er mountain bike without a flat or adding more goo.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Best tubeless sealant around
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t break down the rubber of the tire like some competitors
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came without injection cap.
customer_reviews.text: As with other reviews, mine came without the injection cap. It had a little tube that attaches to the stem, but nothing to attach the bottle to the tube.
customer_reviews.author: CastyMay

customer_reviews.title: Look for other product
customer_reviews.text: 1. The supplied tube does not fit into the tire's valve, needed to look for another (smaller) tube. 2. For sake of convenience, you could include that 5c plastic valve core removal tool. 3. Will see if the tire still leeks and will take one more star off if it does.
customer_reviews.author: Volodia

customer_reviews.title: Make the switch from Stan's
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome. I have always used Stan's and switching to Orange I find I don't need to use as much sealant. My tire bead was dirty and old and this sealed it all right up instantly!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Knight

customer_reviews.title: Is good for hot areas
customer_reviews.text: Prevents flat. I ride my mountain bike 1,000 miles a year and the flats I have had have been secondary to rim failure. Is good for hot areas. Does not dry out as fast as other brands.
customer_reviews.author: JMN

customer_reviews.title: More Expensive But Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Tire sealant is a place to splurge even though no one will see it. Orange Seal is the best I have found. Not sexy, just works. Pro level tip: I like to lubricate the rim and bead with a thin coating of sealant, especially on tires that are tough to mount (or on hookless carbon rims). The sealant lubes just as well as soapy water, and there's no chemistry conflict with the sealant. Just mount the tire halfway, wet your gloved fingers with sealant and run them around the bead and rim. Mount the other side and inflate.
customer_reviews.author: RandyCPU

customer_reviews.title: Incredible performance.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Used a little more than I was anticipating but the tire has held air for three weeks so far and I haven’t had to top it off yet. That’s better performance than I got out of tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Alabaster

customer_reviews.title: Sealed up a good size lotus tree thorn on my first ride with ...
customer_reviews.text: It works. Sealed up a good size lotus tree thorn on my first ride with the Orange Seal. It is orange though.... the stuff that comes out of the hole while sealing will splatter you orange. :)
customer_reviews.author: Knight511

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works amazingly! I don't have any stories about running over big nails or chunks missing, but I have pulled thorns out of my tires and then just spin the wheels and it does great!
customer_reviews.author: Brenden Dominick

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Tires lost 5 psi in 2 weeks over 4 rides in the AZ desert. Outstanding product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Shake well!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe a little messy to set up, but that's tubless mountain bike tires for you. However, I've found it seals the bead extremely well. And punctures? Forget it. Instead of a flat you get a quick "PTTHHHHT!" and a little drop of sealant and that's it. Only thing to note is that you need to shake EXTREMELY well. First bottle I received had the "nanite" sealant particles balled up in the bottom of the bottle. Wasn't able to break it up and it actually clogged the injector hose. Second bottle was almost as bad but after five minutes of shaking they were well dispersed in the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackleford

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Orange seal is a great product, but mine didn’t come with the injector or the dipstick. Fail. I guess I will head to the bike shop next time.
customer_reviews.author: Donna C. Bergman

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Never used this product before. It came highly recommended from a few friends. Constantly dealing with goat heads with my boys bikes. Amazing! Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Best Sealant
customer_reviews.text: This all I use now, seems to be thicker than other brand and easier to get a good sea. I do use the other brands stems and tape.l
customer_reviews.author: M. Belken

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for sealing my new tubeless mtb bike tire
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for sealing my new tubeless mtb bike tire. I tried it on the old one which had a puncture, but the puncture was right beside the rim so it wouldn't seal.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lamy

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed
customer_reviews.text: This stuff worked great in my new tubeless ready fat tires. Only issue is that shutting the cap doesn't seal the bottle very well.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Better than stans
customer_reviews.text: It's not great but good at sealing small holes. Still need bacon for most tire holes.
customer_reviews.author: Pappajok

customer_reviews.title: Worked but out of date
customer_reviews.text: The bottle i received was about 5 months out of date, but product still worked
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Product sealed my tubeless tire and repaired the hole in my tire. Been riding for a couple weeks with zero issues!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Say Na-Na-Na to Goat Head Thorns!
customer_reviews.text: The screw top system for stopping the bottle off and filling with the tube works well. Easy to fill my tubes.
customer_reviews.author: AugsburgTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great item.
customer_reviews.text: The easiest tubeless product to install with the supplied tubing.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Palumbo

customer_reviews.title: Good but pricey
customer_reviews.text: Switched from stans, seems to seal better on my tires.
customer_reviews.author: Chris NY

customer_reviews.title: Orange preference
customer_reviews.text: Just my preferred choice for sealant, especial on carbon wheels
customer_reviews.author: FJ

customer_reviews.title: ive used stans before and it dried out very fast ...
customer_reviews.text: ive used stans before and it dried out very fast, the orange lasts at least twice as long before needed to add more to the tire
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor guy

customer_reviews.title: Glad to have it - Hope I don't have to use it.
customer_reviews.text: Glad to have it - Hope I don't have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Used plenty. Did not last long at all at ...
customer_reviews.text: Used plenty. Did not last long at all at around 2 months before it was all dry. Maybe it was the Conti tires? I don't know but I will not be buying again. Thought it was supposed to last longer than the competition. YMMV. I will be sticking with Stan's.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: one tire still had perfect pressure, had to add some air to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Over 100 goatheads in each 29" mountain tire. Carefully pulled them all, and added 4 oc Orange seal each tire. A month later, one tire still had perfect pressure, had to add some air to the rear tire only once. Amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer L

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install/add and in my opinion is better than STANS
customer_reviews.author: Robert Scott

customer_reviews.title: No applicator
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son. sealant came but no applicator as shown in pic. Can't use
customer_reviews.author: Mark Avey

customer_reviews.title: The best I have used
customer_reviews.text: Great value and best sealant I have used and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Denise C.

customer_reviews.title: love the orange
customer_reviews.text: I like this stuff much better than the other products out there. No need for fill kits, the nozzle fits right over your presta valve. No issues with my tires sealing up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A One-Time Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Not sure it ever worked, though I was riding on Kenda tires, so that may be part of the problem. I returned to the always-reliable Stans.
customer_reviews.author: J. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: tires go flat in 2 weeks. refill, same ...
customer_reviews.text: tires go flat in 2 weeks. refill, same thing. with stans this doesn't happen. it's not the rims, its not the tires, it's this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: bwolmarans

customer_reviews.title: Magic!
customer_reviews.text: Works like magic! not sure why the valve and the ext. spout are he same size. Makes it a bit harder to get the substance in the tire and can be messy if you aren't taking your time.
customer_reviews.author: Abundanceandjoy

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff worked like a charm. It sealed up almost instantly. I used about 3.5oz on my 29+ tires.
customer_reviews.author: MTBFLA

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy orange squeezy
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Easy to use, and lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: richard nelson

customer_reviews.title: No injector despite listing says there is one.
customer_reviews.text: The listing clearly states that this includes the injector. I just recieved the item and there is no injector.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Balliet

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff, does the job and seals holes no problem. Had one that was at least 1/4in had my doubts but it sealed, had some sealant on me and the bike but only lost a couple of psi. Just kept riding. Love this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: deltabravo

customer_reviews.title: Bad @$$! Clogs up just about hole in your ...
customer_reviews.text: Bad @$$! Clogs up just about hole in your tire or any 20 holes from going though 2 massive goat head bushes in the dark. Seals instantly almost without having to pump up hardly ever
customer_reviews.author: miles phillips

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow instructions
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow instructions, as easy as any sealant out there. Havent had any punctures and i am running 29 psi on my 29er. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: JoFo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t wear expensive bike gear
customer_reviews.text: Stained my custom bib shorts and rain cot when tire popped
customer_reviews.author: JASON

customer_reviews.title: ... as described on my 4 inch fat bike tires best product and fast
customer_reviews.text: Works just as described on my 4 inch fat bike tires best product and fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Great for tubeless or tubes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sealant. You can use less than Stan's. I use it for tubeless as well as tubes. Works in tubes very well.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Clark

customer_reviews.title: Does not include injection system
customer_reviews.text: The injection system that is pictured was either taken on just does not come with the bottle. Either way, scam
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and doesn't want to come out every ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and doesn't want to come out every time I air up my tires. So far so good-no flats.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Used this for my fat bike tubeless conversion
customer_reviews.text: Seals up tires very fast. before using I was not able to shake it up enough to get all material off the walls of the container so I used a wired to scrape it off the side so that it could mix better. This in not the winter one so it can freeze in the high teens, works great in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed. While I didn't flat at all the ...
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. While I didn't flat at all the sealant dries out much quicker in my climate than stan's does. I'll be going back to stans.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a bit cumbersome to use, but works well!
customer_reviews.author: M Pering

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly and was exactly as described. The injection system is easy to use and very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas White

customer_reviews.title: What I liked most of this product is the ease of application
customer_reviews.text: Well I haven't had any punctures yet to say if it works but I do have piece of mind that I'm safe. What I liked most of this product is the ease of application. I did not have to remove the tire at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sent a leaky bottle
customer_reviews.text: Leaked en route. Nothing like cleaning orange colored slime off your hands when you open the mail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Sealant, works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Great Sealant, works like a charm. I got a 1/4 inch piece of wood in my tire, when I pulled it out this stuff sealed it up instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: My first time trying Orange seal but for ease of use it surpasses the other sealants I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Donald McCubbins

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Seals up the tires well and holds for a while.
customer_reviews.author: P. Trusty

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: It did not come with the injection system. Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D Keener

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It seals well but dries out too quickly. After a month it won't seal any new leaks.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Used it my Gravel king 700x38 tires and rode in the Dirty Kanza one leak and it sealed up very quick!!
customer_reviews.author: Orlando g.

customer_reviews.title: Seated tubeless just fine for CX
customer_reviews.text: Used in my Impulse TL wheels with non-tubeless Clement MXP tires. Seated tubeless just fine for CX! Woot!
customer_reviews.author: Fundthmcalculus

customer_reviews.title: expensive
customer_reviews.text: works great it is just a little more expensive than other just as good products
customer_reviews.author: Irene Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great Tire Sealant first time user of tubeless tires on my mountain bike
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Stuff does the job, no doubt about it. ...
customer_reviews.text: Stuff does the job, no doubt about it. It has self plugged many holes in my tires. And keeps them sealed for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Earle Burns

customer_reviews.title: Orange sealant works effectively for small tire puncture.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sealant for tubeless tires on bicycles. Adding 1oz to tire it stopped very small leak.
customer_reviews.author: elena Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Like it so far
customer_reviews.text: Like it so far. A little messy to put in the tire even with the injector. Only time will tell on the way it seals. Will update in future on performance of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Perry

customer_reviews.title: Go tubeless
customer_reviews.text: Works great ,sealed up tight on first try !! Love my tubeless setup
customer_reviews.author: Jose Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Better for tubeless.
customer_reviews.text: Use in my tubeless, lighter than Stan's, seems to last longer, doesn't "ball up" so much in tire. Less spray out with goatheads. I still use Stan's in my light weight tubes, Stan's seems to seal quickest in tubes!? Either are far better than slime in your tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Don H

customer_reviews.title: Good sealant
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to install with the included tube. No issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. With the color it is very easy to see where you get any leaks as you set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Tad D

customer_reviews.title: Darn handy stuff
customer_reviews.text: I converted my Easton wheels to tubeless with the Orange Seal kit. Although you can make the sealant yourself, This bottle has an amount that will work on 3-26"X2.2 tires. It also has an injector tube that makes adding the sealant a snap. It is surprising how fast it seals any small to medium air leak. If you find yourself way out "there" this sealant works so well that getting back home should be less of a worry. The reseal bottle cap is unique as well. I have bought 3 more bottles and am in the process of converting my other bikes as well.
customer_reviews.author: GLF

product_meta.title: Orange Seal Cycling Tubeless Tire Sealant with Injection System
feature_bullets: Tubeless tire sealant with eco-friendly formula
Tubeless tire sealant with eco-friendly formula
The quick sealing properties you have come to expect
The quick sealing properties you have come to expect
Performs under varying temperatures and altitudes
